00019 /*
00020  * $Source: /psa/share/repository/pfizer_proj/src/basics/simple_graph.H,v $
00021  * $Revision: 1.2 $

00032 
00033 #ifndef _SIMPLE_GRAPH_HEADER_FILE
00034 #define _SIMPLE_GRAPH_HEADER_FILE
00035 
00036 #include <types.H>
00037 #include <deque>
00038 #include <vector>
00039 
00040 namespace SimSite3D{
00041   // Taken from "A new way to enumerate cycles in graph" in 
00042   // IEEE Proc of the Advanced International Conference on Telecom and ... 
00043   // by Liu, Hongbo and Wang, Jiaxin
00044   template<typename _Tp> class simple_graph{
00045 
00046   public:
00047     typedef typename std::vector<_Tp> _Tp_vec;
00048     typedef typename _Tp_vec::const_iterator _Tp_const_iter;
00049     typedef typename std::vector<_Tp_const_iter> adj_nodes;
00050     typedef typename adj_nodes::const_iterator adj_node_iter;
00051     typedef typename std::vector<adj_nodes> adj_list;
00052     typedef typename std::deque<_Tp_const_iter> path;
00053     typedef typename path::iterator path_iter;
00054     typedef typename path::const_iterator path_citer;
00055     typedef typename std::deque<path> path_queue;
00056     typedef typename path_queue::iterator path_queue_iter;
00057   
00058     simple_graph(const std::vector<_Tp>& V, const adj_list& E, 
00059                  uint min_len_in = 5, uint max_len_in = 6)
00060     {
00061       max_cycle_len = max_len_in;
00062       min_cycle_len = min_len_in;
00063       const _Tp_const_iter V_beg = V.begin(); 
00064       const _Tp_const_iter V_end = V.end(); 
00065 
00066       // Initialize the Q with paths of length zero 
00067       path_queue Q(V.size());
00068       path_queue_iter q = Q.begin();
00069       for(_Tp_const_iter v = V_beg; v < V_end; ++v, ++q) q->push_back(v);
00070 
00071       while(Q.size()){
00072         path& P = Q.front();    
00073         const _Tp_const_iter head = P.front();
00074         const _Tp_const_iter tail = P.back();
00075 
00076         // Check if there is an edge linking tail to head
00077         const adj_nodes& edges = E[head - V_beg];
00078         adj_node_iter hnbr;
00079         for(hnbr = edges.begin(); hnbr < edges.end(); ++hnbr){
00080           if(tail == *hnbr){
00081             if(P.size() >= min_cycle_len && P.size() <= max_cycle_len) 
00082               cycles.push_back(P);
00083             break;
00084           }
00085         }
00086 
00087         //
00088         // add all edges in adj_list for tail which have order > order(head)
00089         // to Q (1 path for each) such that each added vertex is not in P
00090         //
00091         if(P.size() < max_cycle_len){
00092           adj_node_iter tnbr;
00093           const adj_nodes& tail_edges = E[tail - V_beg];
00094           // Find nodes adjacent to tail with order > order(head)
00095           for(tnbr = tail_edges.begin(); tnbr < tail_edges.end(); ++tnbr)
00096             if(head < *tnbr){
00097               // Check if this node is already included in the current path
00098               path_iter p;
00099               for(p = P.begin(); p < P.end() && *tnbr != *p; ++p);
00100               if(p != P.end()) continue;
00101   
00102               // Add path P to Q and append the node *tnbr to the path P -- do 
00103               // not push back onto P itself; doing so will mess all iters to P
00104               Q.push_back(P);
00105               Q.back().push_back(*tnbr);
00106             }
00107         }
00108         Q.pop_front();
00109       }
00110 
00111       remove_duplicate_cycles();
00112     }
00113 
00116     inline unsigned int num_cycles() const { return cycles.size(); }
00117 
00120     inline std::vector<uint> cycles_that_contain(const _Tp_const_iter node)
00121     {
00122       std::vector<uint> cycle_nums;
00123       for(path_queue_iter c = cycles.begin(); c < cycles.end(); ++c)
00124         for(path_iter p = c->begin(); p < c->end(); ++p)
00125           if(*p == node){
00126             cycle_nums.push_back(c - cycles.begin());
00127             break;
00128           }
00129       return cycle_nums;
00130     }
00131 
00132     inline void get_cycle(uint cycle_num, adj_nodes* vertices)
00133     {
00134       path_queue_iter c = cycles.begin() + cycle_num;
00135       vertices->resize(c->size());
00136       std::copy(c->begin(), c->end(), vertices->begin());
00137     }
00138 
00139   private:
00140     uint max_cycle_len;  
00141     uint min_cycle_len;  
00142     path_queue cycles;   
00143 
00146     void remove_duplicate_cycles()
00147     {
00148       std::vector<bool> dup(cycles.size(), false);
00149       for(uint i = 0; i < cycles.size(); ++i){
00150         if(dup[i]) continue;
00151 
00152         for(uint j = i+1; j < cycles.size(); ++j){
00153           if(dup[j]) continue;
00154 
00155           uint a;
00156           for(a = 0; a < cycles[i].size(); ++a){
00157             uint b;
00158             for(b = 0; b < cycles[j].size(); ++b){
00159               if(cycles[i][a] == cycles[j][b]) break;
00160             }
00161             if(b >= cycles[j].size()) break;
00162           }
00163           if(a >= cycles[i].size()){
00164             dup[j] = true;
00165             cycles[j].clear();
00166           }
00167         }
00168       }
00169       
00170       for(path_queue_iter c = cycles.begin(); c < cycles.end(); ++c){
00171         if(c->size() == 0){
00172           cycles.erase(c);
00173           c = cycles.begin();
00174         }
00175       }
00176     }
00177 
00178   };
00179 }
00180 #endif
Generated on Tue Apr 3 23:09:18 2012 for simsite3d by  1.4.7
